column4: The wireless card in my laptop isn't turning on, or at least hte blue LED isn't lighting up indicating that it is on. I have installed ndiswrapper and the winxp drivers for it. I also set a manual configuration for it putting in the SSID and the network key and such. The problem is that the card isn't on, the card just isn't on... when I hit the wifi button, nothing happens. Any suggestions?
what kinda card is it?
it is: Network controller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4318 [AirForce One 54g] 802.11g wireless LAN Controller (rev 02)
that card is supported in-kernel, you just need firmware for it
I'm not really good with Linux.. if it requires recompiling the kernel.. I'd rather try something different..
http://www.mediafire.com/?bqn8x4eancv download that file and extract it to /lib/firmware
no recompiling, and ill help you extract it when u get to that point
also remove ndiswrapper
how did you install it?
sudo apt-get remove ndiswrapper
couldn't find the package ndiswrapper.. I think it was something to the effect of ndis-utils
whatever it was you have to remove it because it will conflict with the in-kernel driver
is there just any way I can get the ndiswrapper to work?
partially why I went for ndis was somebody had extremely bad luck with the in-kernel driver
the in-kernel driver works quite well as of the 7.10 kernel
